title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
description: A magical and enchanting tale about a mysterious circus that appears only at night, captivating all who enter.

title: The Goldfinch
author: Donna Tartt
description: A coming-of-age novel that follows a young boy who survives a terrorist attack at an art museum, changing the course of his life.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
description: A reimagining of the life of Circe, the sorceress from Greek mythology, with a focus on her struggles and transformations.

title: The Underground Railroad
author: Colson Whitehead
description: An alternate history novel that follows a young woman escaping slavery via a literal underground railroad.

title: A Gentleman in Moscow
author: Amor Towles
description: Set in the aftermath of the Russian Revolution, this novel tells the story of a Russian aristocrat under house arrest at a luxury hotel.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: An exploration of the history of the human species, from the emergence of Homo sapiens to the present day.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a woman who grows up in a strict and abusive household in rural Idaho but eventually escapes to learn about the wider world through education.

title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
author: Rebecca Skloot
description: A biography that explores the life of Henrietta Lacks and the impact of her cells on medical science.

title: Into the Wild
author: Jon Krakauer
description: A true story of Christopher McCandless, a young man who gives up everything to live in the Alaskan wilderness.

title: The Wright Brothers
author: David McCullough
description: A biography of the inventors Orville and Wilbur Wright, who achieved the first powered, controlled, and sustained flight.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who shoots her husband and then stops speaking, leading to a gripping exploration of the truth behind the crime.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A novel that combines mystery, romance, and coming-of-age elements, set in the marshes of North Carolina.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: Set during World War II, this novel is narrated by Death and tells the story of a young girl's relationship with her foster parents, the other residents of their neighborhood, and a Jewish fist-fighter.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel that follows a young Andalusian shepherd named Santiago on his journey to Egypt.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A novel that explores the friendship between two boys in Afghanistan and the impact of betrayal and redemption.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: The memoir of the former First Lady of the United States, offering insights into her life, experiences, and journey.

title: The Glass Castle
author: Jeanette Walls
description: A memoir that recounts the author's unconventional and often difficult upbringing with her dysfunctional family.

title: Long Walk to Freedom
author: Nelson Mandela
description: The autobiography of Nelson Mandela, detailing his life, imprisonment, and role in the struggle against apartheid in South Africa.

title: Steve Jobs
author: Walter Isaacson
description: A biography of Apple co-founder Steve Jobs, exploring his life, career, and impact on the technology industry.

title: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: The diary of Anne Frank, a Jewish girl hiding with her family during the Holocaust, providing a poignant account of her experiences.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A psychological thriller about a husband and wife whose marriage takes a dark turn when the wife goes missing.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A gripping mystery novel involving a journalist and a computer hacker as they investigate a wealthy family's dark secrets.

title: Big Little Lies
author: Liane Moriarty
description: A mystery novel that explores the lives of three women whose seemingly perfect lives unravel to reveal dark secrets.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A gripping mystery that follows a symbologist and a cryptologist as they unravel a conspiracy that spans centuries.

title: The Hound of the Baskervilles
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: A classic Sherlock Holmes mystery that follows the detective as he investigates the supernatural death of Sir Charles Baskerville.

title: The Reversal
author: Michael Connelly
description: A legal thriller featuring defense attorney Mickey Haller as he takes on a high-profile case with political implications.

title: The Girl on the Train
author: Paula Hawkins
description: A psychological thriller that follows the intertwined lives of three women, exploring themes of deception, obsession, and manipulation.

title: In the Woods
author: Tana French
description: The first book in the Dublin Murder Squad series, featuring detective Rob Ryan investigating a young girl's murder in a small Irish town.

title: When Breath Becomes Air
author: Paul Kalanithi
description: A poignant memoir by a neurosurgeon diagnosed with terminal cancer, reflecting on life, death, and the meaning of existence.

title: The Nightingale
author: Kristin Hannah
description: A historical novel set in France during World War II, focusing on the lives of two sisters and their experiences during the conflict.

title: Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine
author: Gail Honeyman
description: A novel about a socially awkward woman named Eleanor Oliphant and her journey towards self-discovery and connection with others.

title: Little Fires Everywhere
author: Celeste Ng
description: A novel that explores the complexities of motherhood, identity, and race relations in a suburban community.

title: The Tattooist of Auschwitz
author: Heather Morris
description: A novel based on the true story of a Holocaust survivor who becomes the tattooist at the Auschwitz-Birkenau concentration camp.
